quash.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to officially say that a legal judgment or decision is no longer acceptable or correct
quash.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The High Court later quashed his conviction for murder.
The decision was quashed by the House of Lords.
quash.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to say or do something to stop something from continuing
quash.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: A hospital chief executive has quashed rumours that people will lose their jobs.
The government immediately moved to quash the revolt.
quash.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to officially state that a judgement or decision is no longer legal or correct
quash.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: He was found guilty but had his conviction quashed later on appeal.
quash.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to stop something from starting or developing
quash.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Car-rental companies say they quashed a state government plan to double Floridaâ€™s car rental surcharge.
A hospital chief executive has quashed rumours that nursing staff will lose jobs.
